Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First lets understand the current process tree and its issues The current model is underfitting because it allows activities to occur in any order within a parallel block This means for example you could pay an invoice before receiving goods or before receiving the invoice itself which is not logical in a Procure to Pay process

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The standard process steps are 1 Create Purchase Requisition 2 Approve Purchase Requisition 3 Create Purchase Order 4 Receive Goods 5 Receive Invoice 6 Match Invoice to PO 7 Pay Invoice 8 Close Case Now lets analyze which steps must be in sequence and which can be parallel Typically Steps 1 and 2 Creating and approving the requisition must be sequential Step 3 Create Purchase Order comes after approval

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait but you cant match the invoice to PO before receiving both goods and invoice Wait no matching requires both the goods receipt and the invoice Wait actually in standard procure to pay Steps 4 and 5 Receiving goods and receiving invoice can be parallel but both must be done before step 6 because matching requires both

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: lets map dependencies 1 before 2 Cant approve before creating 2 before 3 Cant create PO before approving requisition 3 before 4 Cant receive goods before PO 3 before 5 Same for invoice 4 before 6 To match need received goods 5 before 6 Need received invoice 6 before 7 Cant pay unmatched invoice 7 before 8 Cant close before paying Ah thats a key point step 6 requires both 4 and 5

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: What about order of step 4 and 5 Can receive invoice before goods or vice versa Yes so parallel but both before 6 Step 3 before both 4 and 5 All others sequential So structure 1 2 3 sequence then parallel 4 5 then sequence 6 7 8

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: In terms of process tree operators Steps 1 2 3 SEQUENCE Step 3 before PARALLEL of 4 and 5 Step 6 SEQUENCE after parallel then 7 8 Root SEQUENCE of initial_seq PARALLEL_block final_seq initial_seq SEQUENCE create_req approve_req create_po parallel_block PARALLEL receive_goods receive_invoice final_seq SEQUENCE match_invoice pay_invoice close_case

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Test structure against dependencies Correct Create PO before receives parallel any order but both before match pay after match close after pay Prevents unwanted pay before goods or invoice match before receives receive before create PO close before pay Example traces valid like create req approve create po receive invoice receive goods match pay close or reverse goods invoice Unwanted traces invalid All good
